hints.content:
Let's put our numbers into a place value table.

Number | Hundreds | Tens | Ones
- | :-: | :-: | :-:
$\maroonD{224}$ |  $\maroonD2$ | $\maroonD2$ | $\maroonD4$
$\blueE{791}$ | $\blueE7$ | $\blueE9$ | $\blueE1$

Now, we can break apart each number by place value.

$\maroonD{224}=\maroonD{2\text{ hundreds}} + \maroonD{2\text{ tens}} + \maroonD{4\text{ ones}}$.  

$\blueE{791}=\blueE{7\text{ hundreds}} + \blueE{9\text{ tens}}+ \blueE{1\text{ one}}$.
$2\text{ hundreds} + 7\text{ hundreds} + 2 \text{ tens}+9\text{ tens} +4 \text{ ones}+1 \text{ one}$ is the same as $224 + 791$.

question.content:
**Which addition problem is the same as $224+791$?**

[[â˜ƒ radio 1]]

choices.content: $\small 2\text{ ones} + 7\text{ ones} + 2 \text{ tens}+9\text{ tens} +4 \text{ hundreds}+1 \text{ hundreds}$
$\small 2\text{ hundreds} + 7\text{ hundreds} + 2 \text{ tens}+9\text{ tens} +4 \text{ ones}+1 \text{ one}$
$\small 2\text{ hundreds} + 2\text{ hundreds} + 4 \text{ tens}+7\text{ tens} +9 \text{ ones}+1 \text{ one}$
